statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Harvard 91, Mercer 73
article.story: BOSTON (AP) -- Jeremy Lin scored 23 points to carry Harvard 91-73 over Mercer Friday night in Tommy Amaker's first home game as the Crimson's coach. Amaker, fired at the end of last season after six years at Michigan, saw his new team even its record at 2-2. Harvard opened at the Stanford Invitational, losing to No. 23 Stanford and UC Santa Barbara and beating Northwestern State. Lin had his third straight career scoring high, along with nine rebounds and nine assists. He was 10-for-17 from the field and turned the ball over just once in 35 minutes. Drew Housman added 19 points, five assists and three steals for Harvard, which also got 16 points and nine rebounds from Evan Harris and a game-high 12 rebounds from Pat Magnarelli. Mercer (1-2), which upset USC in Los Angeles on Saturday before losing by seven points to Alabama on Tuesday, rallied from an eight-point deficit and used a 14-5 run to lead, 60-59, with 9:53 remaining. The Crimson scored 10 unanswered points over 2:48, and put up 32 points, including 12 from Lin, in the final 9:18 of the game. Calvin Henry led Mercer with 14, while Shaddean Aaron and Sam Dolan had 11 apiece. Guard James Florence, who had 52 points in the Bears' first two games, scored only nine and shot 3-for-18 from the field. Mercer had averaged just under 90 points per game this season. The Bears play at Boston College on Sunday.
